db.orientdb.control

Class OrientDBComponentConfigurationController

  • java.lang.Object
    • db.orientdb.control.OrientDBComponentConfigurationController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ComponentConfigurationController

    public final class OrientDBComponentConfigurationController
extends java.lang.Object
implements ComponentConfigurationController
    Implements ComponentConfigurationController using OrientDB as the database backend.

    TODO:
    - ALL exceptions need to be caught, wrapped with a databaseException and be rethrown.
    - Check OrientDB's threading/version management. Currently elements are researched recursively on every access. Existing elements already extracted from the DB cannot be used as a starting point for further actions because the version management used within OrientDB doesn't play nicely with that scenario (it sometimes leads to exceptions because of writing to outdated elements). This is OK for now but should definitively change in the future to give a little speed boost here.
    - It would be nice to have data elements linked in both ways (-> parent element), but same problem as above.

    Author:
    Stefan Werner

      • getChildElements

        public java.util.Set<DataElement> getChildElements(java.lang.String domain,
                                                   java.lang.String[] path)
                                            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                   DatabaseException
        Description copied from interface: ComponentConfigurationController
        Gets all child Elements of a parent element. IMPORTANT: Regarding the returned value, NULL is not the same as an empty Set! Example: An element with type FILE could have no children Set and would therefore return NULL, but a FOLDER type element could have an empty children Set that represents an empty folder. It is NOT up to the database to enforce that!
        Specified by:
        getChildElements in interface ComponentConfigurationController
        Parameters:
        domain - the domain
        path - the path
        Returns:
        A Set of child elements or NULL if no such parent element or if parent element does not contain children Set.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - the illegal argument exception
        DatabaseException - the database exception
